item.title: VIM Cheat Sheet
item.author: mail@richardmillen.com (Richard Millen)
item.description: Cursor Move Jump Other h - move cursor left w - jump forwards to the start of a word gg - go to the first line of the document j - move cursor down W - jump forwards to the start of a word (words can contain punctuation) G - go to the last line of the document k - move cursor up e - jump forwards to the end of a word 5G - go to line 5 l - move cursor right E - jump forwards to the end of a word (words can contain punctuation) ; - repeat previous f, t, F or T movement H - move to top of screen b - jump backwards to the start of a word , - repeat previous f, t, F or T movement, backwards M - move to middle of screen B - jump backwards to the start of a word (words can contain punctuation) zz - center cursor on screen L - move to bottom of screen % - move to matching character (default supported pairs: ‘()’, ‘{}’, ‘[]’ - use :h matchpairs in vim for more info) Ctrl + b - move back one full screen 0 - jump to the start of the line Ctrl + f - move forward one full screen ^ - jump to the first non-blank character of the line Ctrl + d - move forward 1⁄2 a screen $ - jump to the end of the line Ctrl + u - move back 1⁄2 a screen g_ - jump to the last non-blank character of the line fx - jump to next occurrence of character x tx - jump to before next occurrence of character x Fx - jump to previous occurence of character x Tx - jump to after previous occurence of character x } - jump to next paragraph (or function/block, when editing code) { - jump to previous paragraph (or function/block, when editing code) Insert Mode Inserting / Appending Text Editing Cut & Paste i - insert before the cursor r - replace a single character yy - yank (copy) a line I - insert at the beginning of the line J - join line below to the current one with one space in between 2yy - yank (copy) 2 lines a - insert (append) after the cursor gJ - join line below to the current one without space in between yw - yank (copy) the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word A - insert (append) at the end of the line cc - change (replace) entire line y$ - yank (copy) to end of line o - append (open) a new line below the current line cw - change (replace) to the end of the word p - put (paste) the clipboard after cursor O - append (open) a new line above the current line c$ - change (replace) to the end of the line P - put (paste) before cursor ea - insert (append) at the end of the word s - delete character and substitute text dd - delete (cut) a line Esc - exit insert mode S - delete line and substitute text (same as cc) 2dd - delete (cut) 2 lines xp - transpose two letters (delete and paste) dw - delete (cut) the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word u - undo D - delete (cut) to the end of the line Ctrl + r - redo d$ - delete (cut) to the end of the line .
